insights.title: American Summer Surge
insights.text: US travelers flooding Iceland: 660K TTM passengers, up 8% (+48,752). June-August peaked at 96K/month average. Americans now 5x larger than Canadian market, cementing transatlantic dominance.

insights.title: British Retreat Accelerates
insights.text: UK traffic down 10.1% (-28,222 passengers) as largest declining market. Brief spring recovery (Feb-Mar: +41K) erased by weak summer. Market share slipped to 11.8% from previous 13%+.

insights.title: German Stability Cracks
insights.text: Germany's reliable 290K steady-state showing first signs of pressure. October dropped 23% vs prior year (13.3K vs 17.2K). Previously Iceland's most predictable European market now uncertain into Q4.

insights.title: Winter Chill Arriving
insights.text: October 2025: 199K passengers (-6.2% YoY), second straight monthly decline post-summer. Peak season momentum fading faster than 2024. Foreign traffic still up 2.5% TTM but growth rate slowing.

insights.title: International Island
insights.text: Foreign passengers hit 2.3M TTM, representing 92% of KEF traffic. With Iceland's 400K population, that's 5.7x islanders in foreign visitors annually. Tourism dependency reaches new high.
